column4: Hey, I'm getting the error 'modprobe: FATAL: Could not load /lib/modules/2.6.28-11-generic/modules.dep: No such file or directory' on install attempt... any ideas?
I'm getting the error 'modprobe: FATAL: Could not load /lib/modules/2.6.28-11-generic/modules.dep: No such file or directory' on install attempt... and I just verified that modules.dep is there....
did you upgrade the kernel without rebooting?
did you just install updates?
when does that message come up?
Ubuntu 9.04?
are you booting off a CD or usb key?
ah. I had a similar problem I think booting 9.04 Ubuntu off of a USB key, but Kubuntu worked fine. Don't know about netbook remix, though
what model is your tablet?
ah, with the ntrig digitizer?
do you have a link? I've been trying to get the touch working but with no luck
I have an HP model, but with the same digitizer. My ATI card works fine with the restricted drivers
I think it's an ATI 3200HD
but do you have a link to the article you were reading with the patches?
ah, thanks. Missed it up there
the older versions don't support the newer kernels you'll probably need for your digitizer
yeah =/
although, the OSS driver might work ok
yeah, that's the one
IIRC 8.10 might have a working graphics driver for that card as well, I think 9.04 was when they dropped support
http://www.ubuntumini.com/2008/10/installing-ubuntu-netbook-remix.html <-- for dell mini but should be applicable
and the HP tx2 line, which has ATI cards too
